Lack enough support: The claim lacks critical details such as when and where the confession occurred, and there is no documentation of the existence of a former CIA agent named Malcolm Howard outside of the article.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the confession of a dying CIA agent is true and reliable without providing any substantial evidence to support it.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the established fact that fire alone caused the collapse of WTC Building 7, as supported by evidence.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the alleged confession, presenting it as an astonishing revelation without sufficient evidence.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on a fake news site, YourNewsWire, which has a history of publishing false stories and lacks credibility.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that fire was the cause of the collapse, as supported by evidence, and instead promotes the conspiracy theory of controlled demolition.
Understate: There is no evidence provided to understate the significance of the claim, as it is already lacking in credibility and factual support.
